summary: A letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to the Metropolitan Detention Center, transmitting witness materials for inmate Ghislaine Maxwell in her criminal case.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the correspondence, an inmate at the Metropolitan Detention Center for whom witness materials are being provided.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: The United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York who signed the letter transmitting materials.

locations: U.S. Department of Justice, Southern District of New York, The Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC) Legal Department, 80 29th Street, Brooklyn, NY 11232
keyFacts: The document is official correspondence from the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330).
It confirms Ghislaine Maxwell was an inmate at the Metropolitan Detention Center in Brooklyn as of April 2021.
The U.S. Attorney's Office was providing witness materials to Maxwell for her defense preparation.
Audrey Strauss was the acting United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York at the time.
